SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
COMMERCE MARKETPLACE
The Seller Portal

The Seller Portal is a business management tool that connects sellers and Marketplace operators. As the Marketplace operator, you determine the resources that the seller can access based on your license type. To allow a seller full access to the seller portal, you grant them a Community Plus license and customize the portal in Experience Builder.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
For more information about customization, refer to the Experience Builder documentation.
Add an Import Component to the Home Page
After you set up an import component, make that component available to the seller in the Seller Portal.
Configure the Dashboard on the Home Page
You can configure the dashboard on the home page with Digital Experience.
Add Object Pages
Quickly add an object to the page you create.
Create a Page in the Seller Portal
You can also use Digital Experience to create a page in the Seller Portal.
Create the Navigation Menu
To make each feature of the seller portal accessible to the user, add menu items to the default navigation menu.
Configure the Navigation Menu
Quickly set up the navigation menu of the Seller Portal using Digital Experience.
Publish and Activate the Seller Portal
When you’ve finished setting up and testing the seller portal, you can publish and activate the digital experience so that sellers can access it.
DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!
Yes
No
title: Setting Up and Customizing Seller Portal in Salesforce Commerce Marketplace
